info.title: Shipnow API
info.description:
ShipNow exposes it's information using RESTful interface. Detailed
documentation of every endpoint is available below.

Making requests
---------------

 * Our production API is hosted at https://api.shipnow.com.ar.
 * Our testing API is hosted at https://api-staging.shipnow.com.ar.

If you need to test your clients, feel free to pollute the testing API with
test data, though keep in mind that it will be cleared every few hours.

On occasions, testing may diverge slightly from production. This should not
last long, since we generally deploy to one and quickly to the other. If you
find such discrepancies, don't worry, since they should quickly propagate to
production.

Both APIs use HTTPS (ie: HTTP + TLS) exclusively. You MUST NOT attempt to reach
them using raw HTTP.

Authentication
--------------

Authentication is not yet done via OAuth, but a simpler password-based
mechanism.

Users will provide their username and password, which you will then exchange
for a `Token` by `POST`ing to `/user/authentication`, using HTTP Basic
Authentication (as defined in [rfc2617][rfc2617]). This will return the entire
user object, which contains the user's token:

    {
        "id": 1,
        "email": "hugo@barrera.io",
        "token": "VXyuYdTflB9NY1KUMfcddDcAJeye4vfAv7cZg8m7qDNmhuZ3V6",
        "type": "human",
        "description": "Hugo",
        "role": "admin",
        "account": {},
        "avatar_url": null
    }

This token should be included in every request header to operate on behalf of
the user, inside the `Authorization` header, as follows:

    Token token=gNGQNzZ2muAdRKZT3miNccnwYxSrZ6zl2t1B6l6tcHpUw00pok

You SHOULD NOT store user's username or password. You should only store the
provided token.

Accounts vs Users
-----------------

Each client has a single account, which in turn, has multiple users. An account
will hold all orders and products for that client, which all users of that
account can access (with different access levels).

Each account can have as many users as they need.  Additional users can be
created via the API or the sellers interface.

Access Levels
-------------

Users can have three access levels:

 * ShipNow: These are internal account, that can access data for all clients,
   and are used internally when actually moving products around.
   You will generally never see these user types unless you're deploying
   the ShipNow app for your own warehouse.
 * Administrator: These are the top-level users for each account, and can
   create other users, as well as a few more special actions.
 * Regular: These are the lower-level users, which can create/edit orders,
   product, and use other day-to-day interfaces.
   Bot accounts should generally also be regular users.

Stores
------

Each account can have multiple stores. Stores represent different points of
sales (eg: MercadoLibre, TiendaNube, eBay, retail, etc).

If you link shipnow to one of our integrated stores via the web ui, a new
store will be created for each one. The `store_type` field should help
reveal which integration that is.

A single account may also have more than one store for the same store type
(eg: a single account can be linked to two MercadoLibre profiles).

If your intention is to read order data from ShipNow, you generally won't
pay much attention to stores. If your intention is to create orders, you'll
probably want to use the store type "custom".

You can create as many stores as you need, and it's generally recommended
that you use one per application you're integrating, or per point of sales.

Data
----

All data is sent and received using [JSON][json]. Request data will be
contained inside a `results` object:

    {
        "results": [
           {
              "id": 1,
              "name": "sample object 1",
              "created_at": "2017-12-14T15:42:12.898Z"
           }
        ]
    }

All models also contain `updated_at` and `created_at` fields. They are the
last-update and creation times respectively  and cannot be manually edited.

In case of a 4XX or 5XX status code, errors MAY be included in an errors array:

    {
        "errors": [
            "Access Denied"
        ]
    }

We adhere quite closely to [HTTP 1.1][http1.1], with one exception: When data
validation fails, we will return a 422 status code.

Pagination
----------

By default, all endpoints will return at most the first twenty elements
inside the `results` array. To obtain other elements include the `page`
query parameter, eg:

    https://api.shipnow.com.ar/orders?page=2

The link to the next and last pages can be found in the `Link` HTTP headers:

   <https://api-staging.shipnow.com.ar/orders?page=20>; rel="last", <https://api-staging.shipnow.com.ar/orders?page=2>; rel="next"

Page indexes are 1-based, meaning that the first pages is one, and NOT zero.

Webhooks
--------

You can receive notifications in your app when certain event occur. For now,
the only available notification is order creation/update.

Notifications are delivered via webhooks, which you can configure by
setting the `webhook_url` to your account (see the `/account` documentation
below).

Webhook notifications will be delivered by `POST`ing data about the event
with the following format:

    {
      "account": 1,
      "topic": "order/created",
      "resource_id": 1
    }

 * `account` is the account for which this notification applies.  This will
    only be relevant to you if your application handles multiple ShipNow
    accounts.
 * `topic` describes the event, and is composed of `model:event`. `event`
   can be either `created` or `updated`, and model can only be `order`
   (This WILL change in future, so don't blindly assume it's always
   `order`!
 * `resources_id` is the `id` of the model which fired this notification
   (eg: the id of the order that has been created).

Contributing
------------

This documentation is hosted publicly at [GitHub][github].  If you find any
error or room for improvement, feel free to send a contribution.

If you encounter any undocumented behaviours, or bugs in the API, please open an
issue in this project's issue tracker. We'll update the documentation (or fix
the underlying issue).

Copyright (c) 2016 ShipNow SRL <developers@shipnow.com.ar>

[json]: http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf
[http1.1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616
[github]: https://github.com/shipnow/docs
[rfc2617]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2617#section-2

get.description:
Returns all orders from the system to which the user has access. This
will generally be all the orders for the account related to the current
user.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: filter by status

parameters.name: date_from
parameters.description: exclude orders created before this date

parameters.name: date_to
parameters.description: exclude orders created after this date

parameters.name: status_detail
parameters.description: filter by status_detail

parameters.name: external_reference
parameters.description: find order with this external_reference

parameters.name: carrier_code
parameters.description: filter by carrier_code

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: filter by store

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: filter orders with the product with this sku

parameters.name: tracking_number
parameters.description: find order with this tracking_number

post.description: Creates a new order, and returns it with its new id.

get.description: Returns an order identified by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of order to fetch

404.description: Order with given id not found.

put.description:
Update an existing order. Note that not all fields are editable at all
times. Once orders have been packed, items and shipping data cannot be
altered. Only certain status transitions are valid.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the order to be updated.

delete.description: Deletes a single order based on the id supplied.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of order to delete.

get.description:
Returns the shipment for this order. Older orders MAY have more than
one shipment if they were returned.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order for which this shipment applies.

404.description: Order with given orderId not found.

get.description: Returns all the products to which the user has access.

parameters.name: external_reference
parameters.description: Filter by this external_reference.

200.description: A list of zero or more products.

post.description: Creates a new product, and returns it with its new id.

get.description: Returns a product identified by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the product to fetch.

404.description: Product with given id not found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the product to be updated.

delete.description: Delete a single product based on the id supplied.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of product to delete.

get.description: Returns all users for the current user's account.

post.description:
Creates a new user for this account.

Note that the calling user requires `admin` priviledges for this call
to work (ie: `user.type` must be equal to `admin`)

get.description: Returns a user identified by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the user to fetch.

404.description: User with given id not found.

put.description:
Update an existing User.

Users of type `admin` can update all users for an account. `regular`
users can only edit themselves.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the User to be updated.

403.description: Current User cannot modify target User.

delete.description:
Delete a single User based on the id supplied.

Only users of type `admin` can call this endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of User to delete.

403.description: Current User cannot delete target User.

post.description:
Authenticates a user and returns an API-compatible token.
Implementations should provide the username and password using HTTP
Basic Auth (as defined in RFC2617).

get.description:
Returns all accounts to which the user has access - this will almost
always be just the user's account.

put.description:
Update an account.
Only `admin`-type users can update accounts, and they can only update
their own.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Account to be updated.

403.description: Current User cannot modify target Account.

get.description: Returns all stores for the current user's account.
Returns the Store identified by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of order to fetch.

404.description: A Store with the given id not found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Store to be updated.

delete.description: Deletes a single Store based on the id supplied.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of Store to delete.

get.description: Returns the ShippingService identified by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of ShippingService to fetch.

404.description: A ShippingService with the given id not found.

get.description: Use this endpoint to test connectivity to the ShipNow API, response times, or debug other possible network-related issues.

200.description: This endpoint will always return the string "pong".

auth.description: Used to obtain a per-user token.

external_reference.description: A free-form text to later find this order.

store_id.description: The id of this order's store.

store_type.description: The store_type for this order's store.

items.description: The items (products) included in this order.

id.description: The id of a product. See /products.

quantity.description: The amount of this product that this order contains.

external_reference.description: A free-form text to later find and search this product.

title.description: A name for this product. This is free-form text, and is only used for display purposes.

price.description: This product's price. Insurance coverage will be based on this price.

currency.description: The currency for this product's price. Should be ARS, for now.

image_url.description: A URL to an image that visually identifies this product.

extra_data.description: A free-form JSON field where custom data can be stored for each product.

description.description: A free-form description for this user.

avatar_url.description: The URL to an avatar used to idenfity this user.

image_url.description: The URL to an image used to idenfity this account.

webhook_url.description:
The URL where webhooks notifications are sent to. See the
documentation on webhooks for more details.

name.description: A name to identify this store.

credentials.description: A free-form JSON field where credentials to upstream stores are save.

image_url.description: The URL to an image to identify this store
image_url.default: The image_url for the Store's store_type

store_type.description: The store_type for this order's store.

external_reference.description: A free-form text to later find and search this order.

store_id.description: The id of this order's store.

items.description: The items (products) included in this order.

id.description: The id of a product. See /products.

quantity.description: The amount of this product that this order contains.

external_reference.description: A free-form text to later find and search this product.

title.description: A name for this product. This is free-form text, and is only used for display purposes.

price.description: This product's price. Insurance coverage will be based on this price.

currency.description: The currency for this product's price. Should be ARS, for now.

image_url.description: A URL to an image that visually identifies this product.

extra_data.description: A free-form JSON field where custom data can be stored for each product.

description.description: A free-form description for this user.

avatar_url.description: The URL to an avatar used to idenfity this user.

image_url.description: The URL to an image used to idenfity this account.

webhook_url.description:
The URL where webhooks notifications are sent to. See the
documentation on webhooks for more details.

name.description: A name to identify this store.

credentials.description: A free-form JSON field where credentials to upstream stores are save.

image_url.description: The URL to an image to identify this store
image_url.default: The image_url for the Store's store_type

code.description:
A unique code for this shipping service. It should be more
readable than the id, and will usually be returned when referencing
shipping services.

min_zip_code.description:
Indicates that this shipping service only operates in areas with
zipcode greater than this value.

max_zip_code.description:
Indicates that this shipping service only operates in areas with
zipcode less than this value.

carrier.description: Information about the carrier that provides this shipping service.

code.description:
A unique code for this carrier. It should be more readable than
the id, and will usually be returned when referencing carrier.

name.description: A friendly name for this carrier.

description.description:
A free-form text field that give some information about this
shipping carrier.
